answers.answer: A brain aneurysm can cause the kinds of problems you describe, so it may just be residual damage from the aneurism.  Nevertheless, it's worth going in to see a neurologist about your symptoms.

Hi and welcome to the forum.Considering that you have a number of conditions that can cause the pain that you describe, I think you need to look further there before getting worried. How is your thyroid level now? And especially, what are you doing about this as well as the B12 level? Are you getting treatment for the fibro? Another big question--Are you being tested for diabetes? Since blood tests are all that are needed for most of this, getting updated information is a simple process.Please let us know.ess

question: I AM 49 I HAVE HAD A BRAIN ANEURYSM SOME YEARS AGO . I NOW HAVE UNDER ACTIVE THYROID , B12 DEFFICENCY  , MENIERS  ,AND FIBROMYALGIA  . BUT LATELY I HAVE BEEN SUFFERING WITH STABBING PAINS IN MY TOES NUMBNESS , PINS AND  NEEDLES  IN HANDS FEET AND HEAD . INTENSE HOT SPOTS IN MY BODYBEEN TALKING MUMBO JUMBO LATELY FORGETTING THINGS AND HAVE DEPRESSION . MY WORRIES IS THIS ( M.S ) NOT F.M CAN ANYONE HELP
title: F.M OR M.S
